711148f-a.title: Manhattan: 12th Street (West) - Hudson Street
711148f-a.text:
(1)
299-309 West 12th Street, and 317 West 12th Street at N.W. corner
of Husdson Street.
March 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same.scene shortly after demolition of 299-309 sest 12th
Street.
EG~3538  September 21, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

710054f-a.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - Hudson Street
710054f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, west side, north from its inception at Hudson Street, showing the triangular Abingdon Square that separates these thoroughfares. Across same is a row of buildings on the north side of W. 12th Street. These will be removed for the new apartment house site identified as No. 299 W. 12th Street. Buildings on the right and beyond the street car, extend from this street to Jane Street.
These are to remain.
May 30, 1929
P. L. Sperr

716429f-a.title: Manhattan: Bank Street - Hudson Street
716429f-a.folder: Bank Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720584f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - 12th Street
720584f-a.text:
612 to 622 Hudson Street, east side, from 12th (formerly Troy) to )ane Streets, shortly before demolition of 309-299 West 12th
Street and 612, 614 Hudson Street.
March 7, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

720585f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - 12th Street
720585f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, from 12th (formerly Troy) Street to
Jane Street.
May 30, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

720587f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Bethune Street
720587f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, north from Abingdon Scquare just below Bethune Street, and showing two houses on the N.E. corner of 12th Street, across the park, which are shortly to be demolished. The Laura Spellman Y.W.C.A., on the S.W. corner of 12th Street, is
flying its flag at half-mast.
00ther pictures of these buildings are also filed under Abingdon
Square.
May 30, 1929.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
720587f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Bethune Street, Manhattan, NY

12th Street (formerly Troy 8treet), south side, east from Hudsow
Street (Abingdow Sduare), late in the winter.
March 12, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)

720581f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Bethune Street
720581f-a.text:
General Electric Supply Corporation, 591, 587-585 Hudson Street,
west side, from Bethune to Bank Streets.
At this point the distance between Hudson and Greenwich Streets
is at its minimum. See also Abingdon Square.
March 12, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
720581f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Bethune Street, Manhattan, NY

720582f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Bethune Street
720582f-a.text:
Huudson Street, west side, from Bethune to Jane Streets, seen
across Abingdon Square (q.v.).
March 12, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
720582f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Bethune Street, Manhattan, NY

720583f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Bethune Street
720583f-a.text:
597 to 607-609 Budson Street, west side, Abingdon Scquare, from Bethune to 12th (formerly Troy) Streets. No. 599 Hudson Street (16 Abingdon Square) is the hone (since 1929) of the JJeffersonians, the Tammany club for the Third Assembly District South. See Abingdon SGuare. The clearing in the foreground is the site of the Abingdon
Hotel at 7 Abingdon Square.
No. 607-609 is the Laura Spellman Y. W. C. A.
March 12, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
720583f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Bethune Street, Manhattan, NY

720580f-b.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Bank Street
720580f-b.text:
Huudson Street, west side, from Bank (left of No. 1), to W. 12th (right of No. 2) Streets, showing buildings thereupon as viewed across S clearance on the east side of Abingdon SCuare
between Bank Street and Eignth Avenue.
The thoroughfare in the center separating these blocks is Bethune Street anc thru which appears a glimpse of the Ninth Avenue "El" running on Greenwich Street. The G. E. Supply Corp. building occupies the Bank-Bethune Street frontage, while to the north are
dwellings between Bethune and W. 12th Streets.
Eighth Avenue begins at this point and runs at the right over the exposed sub-basemehnt and to the front of the exposed
building rears.
The six story building with the white trim, located at the S. W. corner of Hudson and N. 12th Streets is the Laura Spellmian Hall of the Young omen's Cnristian As ociation. The trees partially hiding same are in the triangular park named for the daughter of Sir Peter warren. This separates Eighth Avenue from Hudson Street. Upon the foreground site formerly stood No's. 1, 3, 5, and 7-9 Abingdon Scuare (q.v.); the last being the Abingdon Hotel. These
were demolisned in May 1w3l.
720580f-b.folder: Hudson Street & Bank Street, Manhattan, NY

710057f-a.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - Hudson Street
710057f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, (left) east side, north from Hudson Street (foreground), showing the bandstand silhouetted against a new 6story apartment house. The latter is on Bleecker Street, between the Avenue and Bank Street (right). Irrespective of this, it will bear an Abingdon Square number. To the left is the 16-story apartment house, To. 20 Abingdon Scuare, located at the S. E. corner of
Bth Avenue and 1. 12t) Street.
View 2 is limited to first mentioned feature. The dark 5-story
dwelling at the left is No. 4 Abingdon Sduare.
Nay 12, 1940
April 9, 1940
P. L. Sperr

710057f-b.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - Hudson Street
710057f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, (left) east side, north from Hudson Street (foreground), showing the bandstand silhouetted against a new 6story apartment house. The latter is on Bleecker Street, between the Avenue and Bank Street (right). Irrespective of this, it will bear an Abingdon Square number. To the left is the 16-story apartment house, To. 20 Abingdon Scuare, located at the S. E. corner of
Bth Avenue and 1. 12t) Street.
View 2 is limited to first mentioned feature. The dark 5-story
dwelling at the left is No. 4 Abingdon Sduare.
Nay 12, 1940
April 9, 1940
P. L. Sperr

710055f-a.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - Hudson Street
710055f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, north from Hudson Street, showing in the foreground the Ablngdon Square area. The Park identifying same is at the left. In the background, at 14th Street, appears the County Trust
Company Building.
View 2 is the same area several years later and showing the new apartment houses that have sprung up around the Square. At the left is the 20 story building, No. 299 W. 12th Street. On the right is the 16-story structure, No. 20 Abingdon Square. On the margin one observes the 8-story residential building that replaced the former
Abingdon Hotel (demolished 1931) and adjacent homes.
The last is the latest of all three, having recently been
completed. The other two were finished in 1931.
May 27. 1930 Neg.~2221
May 12, 1940
.L. Sperr

710055f-b.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - Hudson Street
710055f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, north from Hudson Street, showing in the foreground the Ablngdon Square area. The Park identifying same is at the left. In the background, at 14th Street, appears the County Trust
Company Building.
View 2 is the same area several years later and showing the new apartment houses that have sprung up around the Square. At the left is the 20 story building, No. 299 W. 12th Street. On the right is the 16-story structure, No. 20 Abingdon Square. On the margin one observes the 8-story residential building that replaced the former
Abingdon Hotel (demolished 1931) and adjacent homes.
The last is the latest of all three, having recently been
completed. The other two were finished in 1931.
May 27. 1930 Neg.~2221
May 12, 1940
.L. Sperr

710056f-b.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - Hudson Street
710056f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, north from Hudson Street (left and foreground) showi)g the Abingdon Square locale and its towering apartment houses. TPey are the NO. 299 N. 12th Street and the N0. 20 Abingdon Scuare buildiigs. Between same appears the County Trust Company Building at 14th Street. I the right foreground is the park that identifies this area. This is triangular in shape and is formed by the convergence of Hudson Street and the beginning of 8th Avenue. The bandstand at the right is on Bank Street. Bleecker Street separates this from the clearance shown. Ihn 1939 a modern 6-story apartment house
will rise here, bearing an Abfngdon Square address.
Views 2 and 3 emphasize the clearance and adjoining structures.
Note the absence of the 12th Street building.
Views 1,2: June 18, 1931
View 3: Marcl 9, 1933
P. L. Sperr
